page.title: 15Cheshunt Park
page.content: Cheshunt Park,situated near Flamstead End,is the site of a Roman road and settlement.Indeed it is reported that during the stone age an animal related to the rhinosauros lived there.The park is now owned by Broxbourne Council.It is the breeding site of many birds and the habitat of a thrilling wildlife including rabbits and squirrels.The fruit which is from there is sent to markets in London.The park itself is 500yrs old.It occupies 200 acres.The house was built in 1777 and from 1860 to 1960 the Debenham family lived there.During the war approximately 50 bombs fell and there were 3 bunkers established.
